answerText: Mario Vargas Llosa[10] The Canudos uprising of Antonio Conselheiro forms the backdrop for this 1981 Vargas Llosa novel, in which the clashes between the rebels and the government forces become increasingly violent.
heading: Missiles of October |2011 | 10 | 10 | Literature | World | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: He discussed Flaubert's Madame Bovary, noting its author's tendency to use contrasting pairs of elements, in his long essay "The Perpetual Orgy."  For 10 points each: [10] Name this Peruvian author better known for novels such as Aunt Julia and the Scriptwriter and The Time of the Hero.
